name: BAS People API - Version 1 [Test Runner]
description:
### BAS People API - Version 1 - Test Runner Collection

#### Audience

This collection is reserved for automated testing.

For end-user reference, testing and experimentation see the *Reference* collection instead.

#### Usage

TODO:

* Environment
* Token request setup
* Task runner
* Newman

requests.name: Request a person  (by alias)
requests.description:
Requests a specific person by their alias.

#### Usage

Ensure you have a suitable environment selected with the following variables defined:

* `auth-token`: A valid API token generated using the *Request new API token* method
* `sample-person-alias`: An alias (i.e. NERUM ID) of a valid person

responseCode.name: OK
responseCode.detail: Standard response for successful HTTP requests. The actual response will depend on the request method used. In a GET request, the response will contain an entity corresponding to the requested resource. In a POST request the response will contain an entity describing or containing the result of the action.

headers.name: Cache-Control
headers.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

headers.name: Content-Length
headers.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

headers.name: Content-Type
headers.description: The mime type of this content

headers.name: Date
headers.description: The date and time that the message was sent

headers.name: Vary
headers.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

#### Usage

Ensure you have a suitable environment selected with the following variables defined:

* `auth-token`: A valid API token generated using the *Request new API token* method
* `sample-person-alias`: An alias (i.e. NERUM ID) of a valid person

","url":"https://api.bas.ac.uk/people/v1/people/{{sample-person-alias}}","pathVariables":{},"data":[],"headers":"Accept: application/json
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Bearer {{auth-token}}
","dataMode":"params","method":"GET","tests":"","isFromCollection":true,"write":true,"version":2}

requests.name: Blacklist API Token
requests.description:
Blacklists a non-expired API token to prevent any further use.

#### Usage

Ensure you have a suitable environment selected with the following variables defined:

* `auth-token`: A valid API token generated using the *Request new API token* method

requests.name: Request all people
requests.description:
Requests a listing of every person.

#### Usage

Ensure you have a suitable environment selected with the following variables defined:

* `auth-token`: A valid API token generated using the *Request new API token* method

requests.name: Get API heartbeat
requests.description: Returns a successful response if the API is currently available.

requests.name: Request new API token
requests.description:
Requests a new API token using a specified user account.

#### Usage

Ensure you have a suitable environment selected with the following variables defined:

* `auth-username`: The username of a valid API user account
* `auth-password`: The corrisponding password to the API user account

responseCode.name: OK
responseCode.detail: Standard response for successful HTTP requests. The actual response will depend on the request method used. In a GET request, the response will contain an entity corresponding to the requested resource. In a POST request the response will contain an entity describing or containing the result of the action.
